detaileddescription.para: Indicates if this object is valid

memberdef.argsstring: (cv::Mat &in, cv::Scalar color=cv::Scalar(0, 0, 255), int lineWidth=-1, bool writeId=true, bool writeInfo=false) const
memberdef.name: draw

detaileddescription.para: Draws this marker in the input image

Calculates the extrinsics (Rvec and Tvec) of the marker with respect to the camera
markerSize
size of the marker side expressed in meters
CP
parameters of the camera
setYPerpendicular
If set the Y axis will be perpendicular to the surface. Otherwise, it will be the Z axis

memberdef.argsstring: (float markerSize, cv::Mat CameraMatrix, cv::Mat Distorsion=cv::Mat(), cv::Mat Extrinsics=cv::Mat(), bool setYPerpendicular=true, bool correctFisheye=false)
memberdef.name: calculateExtrinsics

detaileddescription.para:
Calculates the extrinsics (Rvec and Tvec) of the marker with respect to the camera
markerSize
size of the marker side expressed in meters
CameraMatrix
matrix with camera parameters (fx, fy, cx, cy)
Distortion
matrix with distortion parameters (k1, k2, p1, p2)
setYPerpendicular
If set the Y axis will be perpendicular to the surface. Otherwise, it will be the Z axis
correctFisheye
Correct fisheye distortion
Given the extrinsic camera parameters returns the GL_MODELVIEW matrix for OpenGL. Setting this matrix, the reference coordinate system will be set in this marker

Returns position vector and orientation quaternion for an Ogre scene node or entity. Use: ... Ogre::Vector3 ogrePos (position[0], position[1], position[2]); Ogre::Quaternion ogreOrient (orientation[0], orientation[1], orientation[2], orientation[3]); mySceneNode->setPosition( ogrePos ); mySceneNode->setOrientation( ogreOrient ); ...
Returns the centroid of the marker
Returns the perimeter of the marker
